SENT.plain: We report here a mentally retarded 32-month-old boy whose initial diagnosis was Angelman syndrome based on his clinical features
Cytogenetic studies showed a normal karyotype
Due to an elevated level of serum creatine kinase activity, we performed analyses to rule out a myopathic process
Although the electromyogram was normal, a few scattered necrotic fibres were seen in the muscle biopsy
DNA and dystrophin studies revealed an in-frame deletion in the 5' region of the dystrophin gene and an abnormal form of the protein product, consistent with a diagnosis of dystrophinopathy
We cannot totally rule out the possibility that this boy has the two separate conditions
